meanings.definition: Tachs: plural of tach, a device for measuring speed
meanings.sent1: The mechanic used the tachs to check the speed of the car engine.
meanings.sent2: She looked at the tachs on the dashboard to see how fast they were going.
meanings.sent3: The tachs decided to have a race to see who could measure speed the fastest.
meanings.sent4: His eyes were like tachs, always measuring the speed of everything around him.
meanings.sent5: The tachs hummed softly as they accurately measured the speed of the machine.

meanings.definition: Tachs: third person singular present of tach, to sew with long, loose stitches
meanings.sent1: She tachs the fabric together with care to create a beautiful quilt.
meanings.sent2: He always tachs the patches of cloth together neatly.
meanings.sent3: The tailor accidentally tachs his sleeve to the tablecloth.
meanings.sent4: Her needle moved like lightning as she tachs the pieces together.
meanings.sent5: The sewing machine tachs quickly, creating a perfect seam.

meanings.definition: Tachs: plural of tach, a tachometer, a device for measuring the speed of a rotating shaft or disk
meanings.sent1: The pilot checked the tachs to ensure the helicopter was flying at the right speed.
meanings.sent2: The engineer installed the tachs to monitor the rotation of the machine.
meanings.sent3: The tachs at the factory were always busy measuring the speed of the equipment.
meanings.sent4: His mind was like a tachs, constantly monitoring the speed of his thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The tachs on the ship's engine were crucial for maintaining a steady speed.
